fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-10714].
  {panel}

When the Confluence system is loaded, it takes a while for the personal space to be created. Thus, some users were under the impression that the process is not executed and they click on the _Create_ button again. This causes the following error exception to be generated and creates confusion among users even though the personal space is already created: \\ \\

{noformat}
com.atlassian.confluence.core.InsufficientPrivilegeException: User [a] does not have the required privileges.
	at com.atlassian.confluence.security.SpacePermissionCoordinator.savePermission(SpacePermissionCoordinator.java:34)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:585)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:296)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.invokeJoinpoint(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:177)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:144)
{noformat}

Hence, a progress bar will be useful.
fields.summary: Add progress bar for personal space creation
Return email threads from the search macro

fields.description: To find the Action class to use for a request, the installed plugins are iterated over and each is used to try and load the Action class.  This results in huge amounts of overhead making Actions unusable in some situations (ajax requests wind up taking several seconds to complete with most of the time being spent in ClassLoaders).  A simple solution would be to create a map of Action uris and the plugins they belong to so that finding the Action class is as simple as looking up the request uri in a map.
fields.summary: Improve plugin provided WebWork action resolution speed

fields.description:
I followed the directions at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Delegate+user+management+to+use+JIRA+logins to the letter and I'm getting the following error on startup:

Feb 12, 2008 5:00:08 PM org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext start
SEVERE: Error listenerStart
Feb 12, 2008 5:00:08 PM org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext start
SEVERE: Context [/confluence] startup failed due to previous errors
Exception in thread "HSQLDB Timer @2a5a5e" java.lang.NullPointerException
        at org.hsqldb.lib.HsqlTimer.nextTask(Unknown Source)
        at org.hsqldb.lib.HsqlTimer$TaskRunner.run(Unknown Source)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:619)

Confluence fails to load; JIRA comes up fine but nothing can be accessed for Confluence.

This is seriously impacting my company's decision to purchase Confluence, which we have an immediate need for.
fields.summary: I'm trying to configure Confluence to utilize the JIRA user management and I'm getting an error on startup.

fields.description:
Including an attached image fails if the image name has an underscore.   

\!test_file.png\!
\!test_file.png|align=left\!
\!https://mysite.com/images/test_file.png\!

...all fail

If I remove the underscore... works just fine.
fields.summary: image attachments fail to display if they contain an underscore

fields.description:
If you have a page with an apostrophe in its title (such as "February's Status"), and click the print icon in the upper right of the page, you get an error on IE6:

The page you were trying to reach does not exist. You may want to try a search, or browse the site to find the page you were looking for.

Note that the original URL for the page represents the apostrophe as "%27", but the URL for the printable version of the page rewrites this as "'".
fields.summary: Cannot print a wiki page that contains an apostrophe in its title on IE6

fields.description:
Just found the Export Space page which is really nice. I want to export a specific page and all descendents. My sub-tree to export has a lot of pages, and there are a lot of pages in the wiki as a whole. At the moment I need to de-select everything and then individually select each page to export.

It would be really nice if the checkboxes behaved like a lot of tree views with checkboxes in other apps. That is, de-selecting should de-select all descendents and selecting should select all descendents.
fields.summary: Improve ability to select/de-select entire sub-tree in the Export Space page
Generate readable page URLs even where page titles include non ASCII characters

fields.description:
Links looks like:

http://wiki.helsinki.fi/pages/listpages-alphaview.action?key=blogs&startsWith=&startIndex=30

should be:

http://wiki.helsinki.fi/pages/listpages-alphaview.action?key=blogs&startIndex=30

Included "&startsWith=" causes empty second page listing of pages starting with letter "A".
fields.summary: Pages Alphabetical View "Next" link doesn't work.
Include more detailed steps and file system configuration for the look and feel modification doc

fields.description:
Investigate the page called ' What's New in Confluence 2.0' and its children:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/What%27s+New+in+Confluence+2.0

To do:
* Delete pages where possible.
* Incorporate material into the main user guide where necessary.
* Remove the links from the [User Guide home page|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+User+Guide] --- but make sure the remaining pages are accessible from somewhere logical.


Steps required for each page which is a candidate for deletion:
*	Find corresponding duplicate page in the non-outdated pages, if it exists, and check if any info needs transferring from the 'outdated' page to the new page.
*	Track incoming links and resolve. (See info tab.) 
*	Check for direct help links from the Confluence application and elsewhere. See http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/TECHWRITING/Confluence+external+links+into+the+docs. Note: This check is not required if the page name actually contains the word 'outdated' or something similar.
*	Delete the 'what's new' page if possible.
*	If cannot delete or unsure, add to a list on the JIRA issue for later consideration.
fields.summary: Clean up the pages in What's New in Confluence 2.0

fields.description:
Attached a file with filename "RE: VST and TOC.msg". The file was automatically renamed to remove the colon - i.e. on the Attachments screen the name shows up as "RE VST and TOC.msg", however on mouseover of the filename link the URL shows up at the bottom of the browser as "RE++VST+and+TOC.msg". i.e. two white spaces between "RE" and "VST".
Page has a link pointing to the Attachment. Entering Wiki Markup Edit mode for the page is fine and the link has two spaces in the appropriate place, however if WYSIWIG mode is selected the two consecutive white spaces are converted to a single white space. Returning to Wiki Markup mode shows that the space is still missing. If page is saved at this point, without manually re-entering the second space, the link to the attachment is broken and highlighted red.
fields.summary: Link to attachment filename with two consecutive whitespaces is broken by WYSIWYG editor
Jiraissues breaks icons links when Jira and Confluence reside on separate servers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-10699].
  {panel}

We are exploring to combine the corporate dictionary with the image repository.
It will be good if a thumbnail of the image can be displayed on the attachment page or as a separate tab like "info" tab.
In this case, all the images related to the terms can be viewed if the users are interested. 
And the pages can be "included" in other pages easily without the images cluttering the page.

Thanks
fields.summary: Display thumbnails of attached images

fields.description:
Referencing/Linking another blogpost "UIL this week", within another blogpost with a similar name, such as "UIL this week" leads to the following exception:

{noformat}
2008-02-12 11:58:15,859 ERROR [http-8090-Processor2] [atlassian.renderer.v2.V2Renderer] render Unable to render content due to system error: null
 -- url: /pages/editblogpost.action | userName: admin | action: editblogpost | page: 1015820
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.confluence.links.linktypes.BlogPostLink.isOnSamePage(BlogPostLink.java:98)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.links.linktypes.AbstractPageLink.setUrlAndTitleWithAnchor(AbstractPageLink.java:54)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.links.linktypes.AbstractPageLink.setUrlAndTitle(AbstractPageLink.java:43)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.links.linktypes.BlogPostLink.<init>(BlogPostLink.java:51)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.links.ConfluenceLinkResolver.makeBlogPostLink(ConfluenceLinkResolver.java:207)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.links.ConfluenceLinkResolver.createLink(ConfluenceLinkResolver.java:132)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor637.invoke(Unknown Source)
{noformat}

Steps to reproduce:

1) Create a blogpost such as "UIL this week"
2) Create another blogpost such as "UIL This week"
3) Refer the first in the second:
{noformat}
[Last week|2008/02/04/UIL+this+week#UILthisweek-NewThisWeek]
{noformat}
4) Visit the second blogpost
fields.summary: Links not resolved for News

fields.description:
I copied code from software developers into my company's user Documentation space to provide examples for users to modify. The code is bracketed within \{code} macro markers. Some long lines of code extend beyond the right edge of the browser window and make the window difficult to read since it requires horizontal scrollling. The entire page is affected.

I ask that the code macro make text wrap around the window edge or be configrable so that users, such as me, can make the text wrap around.
fields.summary: Code macro should wrap

fields.description: The default CSS theme in Confluence 2.7.x produces a horizontal scrollbar when viewing a page in Firefox 2.0.x.  The issue doesn't appear in other browsers, that I know of.  I've been able to eliminate the problem in testing by changing the style at line 1872 (.tabnav, .comment .tabnav) to include "width: 99.9%".
fields.summary: Confluence default theme produces horizontal scrollbar in Firefox 2.0.x

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-10694].
  {panel}

after performing a restore from backup using the last created backup file none of the macros work.
At first I thought that it was a loss of blog-posts as none were being returned, however there are some jiraportlet macros that also do not work.

I have looked in the log file and have found ( I have replaced the username with <<>> as it is the same as my email)
The jfree class that it is trying to initialize has not been replaced, plus looking back at older versions of the jfree library it doesn't look like the 
TimeSeries ever took a string and a class as arguments certainly not version 1.0.8a that we are using.

2008-02-11 10:11:40,305 ERROR [http-9001-Processor10] [renderer.v2.components.MacroRendererComponent] processMacro Unexpected error formatting mac
ro: usage
 -- url: /admin/globalusage.action | userName: <<true username is here>>| action: globalusage
java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: org/jfree/data/time/TimeSeries.<init>(Ljava/lang/String;Ljava/lang/Class;)V
        at com.atlassian.confluence.ext.usage.index.UsageIndexManager$2.collectResult(UsageIndexManager.java:146)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.ext.usage.index.UsageIndexManager$2.collect(UsageIndexManager.java:107)

fields.summary: No macros work after restoring wiki from backup

fields.description: Currently there is no history of which plugins were installed when and by whom.  where some unusual behaviour is noticed , it would be advantageous to be able to check which were the latest plugins installed/enabled or removed/disabled, so that the relevant actions could be backed out to get back to where the installation had been previously.
fields.summary: Add logging as an audit trail for plugins being installed and enabled/disabled
Enable the daily update subscription by default

fields.description:
When decompressing the Standalone version of Confluence an error message is printed at the end of decompression like this:
tar: A lone zero block at 145270

The decompressed result seems to work without problems though.  This warning is apparently caused by different versions of tar having different end of file indicators.  I can't find a definitive link on the topic, but [http://www-1.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?ratlid=cctocbody&rs=984&uid=swg21270445] is okay.

It's odd that this should start happening in our releases suddenly though.
fields.summary: An error message is printed when decompressing confluence-2.7.1-std.tar.gz

The following macros (for example: calendar, float, card, deck) are available in CAC [notation guide|http://confluence.atlassian.com/renderer/notationhelp.action?section=all], but not in confluence distribution version 2.7 and 2.7.1. Does that mean that we are no longer supporting the macros in those versions?

I did not check the notation guides for earlier versions.
fields.summary: Inconsistent wiki notation guide between CAC and distributions

fields.description:
The upgrade task {{ConsolidatePermissionsUpgradeTask}} may remove some space permissions during upgrade which cause users to lose some or all of their space permissions when using a case sensitive database.

h2. Symptoms

* Affected users appear in the logs for the {{ConsolidatePermissionsUpgradeTask}} as having duplicate permissions removed from a space
{noformat:title=Example log messages}
[atlassian.confluence.upgrade.ConsolidatePermissionsUpgradeTask] doUpgrade Consolidating SpacePermissions for Space Example Space (key=Example Space).
[atlassian.confluence.upgrade.ConsolidatePermissionsUpgradeTask] removeDuplicateSpacePermissions Duplicate SpacePermission [REMOVEBLOG,0,null,Joe User] removed.
[atlassian.confluence.upgrade.ConsolidatePermissionsUpgradeTask] removeDuplicateSpacePermissions Duplicate SpacePermission [CREATEATTACHMENT,0,null,Joe User] removed.
...
{noformat}
* Users no longer have their assigned permissions in the spaces
* In the space permissions, rows for "Unknown User" appear. The permissions for this user cannot be removed

At present this has been reported as affecting personal spaces exclusively, but it might be possible for this to affect other spaces.

h2. Cause

It appears that the upgrade task may remove space permission records which are used by the HibernateSpacePermissionDao to correctly associate permissions to users. This occurs because the upgrade task is designed to consolidate permissions assigned to users which only vary by the case of the user name. Unfortunately the permission dao performs a case sensitive lookup against permissions and it is possible that the lookup will no longer match the correct records. The upgrade task is not particular with which record it deletes when consolidating the permissions.

h2. Resolution

The attached class should allow the space permission lookup to find the permissions by performing a case insensitive lookup against the space permission table. We may need to look at a different approach to mitigating this problem in a future release of Confluence (e.g. a fix to the upgrade task perhaps)

To install this patch, shut down Confluence, make the necessary directories and copy the class to {{confluence_installation/WEB-INF/classes/com/atlassian/confluence/security/persistence/dao/hibernate/HibernateSpacePermissionDao.class}}

Permissioning should work correctly once Confluence is restarted.
fields.summary: Some space permissions lost after upgrade to 2.7.1

Users  tried {csv} macro but that does not create a table editable in rich text. User also tried attaching an excel file and using the excel plug in but again that does not create a rich text table that is editable.

fields.description:
When searching Powerpoint documents if there is any text containing 'special characters'  then no text in that section (eg slide, or notes) seems to be indexed. For example text surrounded by smart quotation marks, or where MS Office autocompletes a hyphen/dash to make it longer.

To reproduce, I have attached a zip file with 5 Powerpoint documents. Unzip them and attach all documents to a single page.
1. SlideWithQuotes.ppt
2. NoteWithQuotes.ppt
3. SlideAndNoteWithNoQuotes.ppt
4. SlideAndNoteWithQuotes.ppt
5. NoteWIthLongDash.ppt

Try the following searches once they have been indexed:
1. findslidewithnoquotes
2. findslidewithquotes
3. findnotewithnoquotes
4. findnotewithquotes
5. findslidewithnormaldash
6. findnotewithlongdash

Search 1, 3 and 5 work just fine as those words appear in either slide or note sections where there are no special characters
Search 2, 4 and 6 fail to find any results as those words appear in slide or note sections where there are special characters

This is an issue as we do use Powerpoint documents quite extensively and often attach them to our wiki pages. Many pages end up containing these characters and we are unable to search content effectively.
fields.summary: Powerpoint attachments do not have individual sections indexed when there are 'special characters' in that section
{html} macro using javascript and "window.open" -> new window is created behind source window and even newWindow.focus() does not help

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-10676]. {panel} The HTML that confluence produces needs to be tidied up, made more css accessible and be generally xhtml 1.0 compliant. as an example... putting an image on a page with a caption (and floating it right) results in the following html being generated...

caption goes here
so the class name to control this through css is "navmenu"? that isnt intuitive. Much of the rest of the display/style information is all hardcoded, and therefore css cannot overwrite it. it would be better to leave all this stuff open, and then have a default css entry provide default display. obviously if i had specified background colour and margin then they should be included, but if i havent, then dont include it. there should be id and alt text tags on that image.
fields.summary: generated HTML is not css friendly and not XHTML 1.0 compliant.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-10668].
  {panel}

I have a user who wants to use the site search that allows the user to enter their own query, whilst at the same time only looking at one space and  a specific label.  This feature is not available in any of the search features available in confluence, either core features or plugins (including those available from third parties).  

What is required is the ability to specify which type(s) of content that should be search when the livesearch is executed.  This should also include the labels used to desribe content.  

For example:  

*        {livesearch:id=1|spaceKey=KEY|type=label}  would search labels only 
*        {livesearch:id=1|spaceKey=KEY|type=page, news} would search pages and news only
fields.summary: Live search to be able to only search labels in a specific space

fields.summary: RSS feed displays last person to edit the page as the author

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-10666].
  {panel}

It may perhaps we useful to have a way to disable current licence (under specific circumstances) 
Further, we could improve the way how licence is deployed.

Both of the above may be possible to achieve by having a tool that generates licences in a form of a jar file (or an executable). This jar file can be shipped to a customer instead of a 'textual' description of the licence code. 
Customer that may deploy this {{jar}} and it will have the licence key embedded in it. Thus allowing the application to be instantiated with a valid licence.

Further, we can have a jar file that would contain functionality to disable licence when a 'refund' licence is used or a new licence is provided when the previous one has not expired yet. The class inside the jar can do 'all the work' to check and verify the currently deployed licence on that application, compare it with it's server id and perform all necessary tasks to disabling it's use and substituting it with a new licence.
fields.summary: Option to Deploy and Disable Licence more conveniently

fields.description:
Presently there is no option for a customer to specify where to store attachments when using Confluence Clustered version. It is by design decided to store the attachments in Database only, due to synchronizations issues and tangosal distributed cache, I trust.

I would like to propose two approaches to allow customer to opt for the way attachments should be stored.

1. Store only the *footprint* of the attachment path to the actual File System in the DB. Hence, when application querying a particular attachment, it will retrieve the *footprint* (absolute file path) and fetch it from it's location. 
2. Allow to store attachment in a *shared* filesystem and ensure that all the copying between nodes is synchronised.

_I have no doubt that the above suggested changes are *not* 5 sec fixes and would require appropriate effort being applied_
fields.summary: Allow Clustered instance store attachments on File System

Irrespective of the file type being present on the next page, the search fails on the first page and the action is aborted.

The tool works as expected, if the filetype is listed on the first page within the list of attachments in that space.

Steps to reproduce:

1) Create a space.
2) Add all the files in attached files.zip archive to a page, in the order specified by their names.
3) Search for "htm" in Browse Space > Attachments > Filter By File Extension field. 
Notice that no result is returned, instead of one.

fields.description:
Confluence [2.7.x|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+2.7+Upgrade+Guide#Confluence2.7UpgradeGuide-Usermigration] now uses the Atlassian User as the underlying user management framework. However, there are situation where:

# There are already local users exist in the Confluence instance
# The local users are a member of some existing local groups with certain permission set
# Having the local username possess the same username in the LDAP server
# Integrating with LDAP leads to:
#* The LDAP user (who has the same username as the existing local users) not being a membership of the local groups anymore
#* The LDAP user do not possess the group permission/privilege set 

It would be nice if Confluence provide the ability to retain the local group membership and permission for LDAP users who have the same username with the local user.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-10618].
  {panel}

Hello,
 
I am trying to create a restricted calnedar on our team wiki site. The current command I am using for a tab named 'R1 Schedule' is
 
{calendar:id=R1Schedule\|title=CCIE Rack 1 Schedule}
 
I would like to have the same exact layout and options except for one slight difference. When one adds an event, I would like the time frame to be limited. Normal users are to only be able to add an event from the current day, up to a maximum of 14 days
 
For example. If I come to add an event, I can only add an event for today, and not a future day. Also, there would be a drop down box that allows me to select the numbers of days I would be scheduling the event for.  ie. 1, 2, 3, ..., 6, 7     and possibly have the drop down box up to 14 days.
 
An example of some code I have viewed from a website I have seen is:

<select name="daysneeded" onChange="addDays(this.options[this.options.selectedIndex].value)">
					<option value="initial">initial</option>
				</select>

This creates a drop down box with preset values; the values I need are from 1 up to 14 days. The header above that drop down box is "Days Needed"

Lastly, I also need to allow an administrator to be able to add events at any time, current or future. This is for reservation purposes.
 
I appreciate your time and help.
fields.summary: Restrictions to adding Calendar Events

fields.description:
Trying to use the trusted authentication feature of the Jiraissues macro doesn't work when a user's username is uppercase. JIRA shows the following in its log:

{quote}
2008-01-23 13:59:48,104 INFO \[STDOUT] 2008-01-23 13:59:48,104 ajp-0.0.0.0-6103-8 WARN \[atlassian.seraph.filter.TrustedApplicationsFilter] User 'BOB' referenced by trusted application: 'confluence:7521898' is not found.
{quote}

To reproduce:

1. Have an LDAP repository with a username with uppercase letters, BOB. The LDAP server should do case-insensitive authentication, like in Active Directory.
2. Connect Confluence and JIRA to the LDAP repository. JIRA for authentication only via OSUser, Confluence via Atlassian-User.
3. Set up a local user for 'bob' in JIRA, which must be lowercase because all JIRA usernames must be lowercase.
4. Log in to Confluence as 'bob' (or 'BOB', it doesn't matter). Confluence creates the user as 'BOB', because it respects the case of the underlying system.
5. Use an authenticated \{jiraissues} macro to retrieve issues from JIRA as 'BOB'.
6. The above error message appears in the JIRA log, which can't authenticate 'BOB'.

I'm opening this issue in Confluence to start with, although perhaps in the end it will be fixed in JIRA.

Note that the most common case for installations using trusted authentication is with an external user repository like LDAP, so this is a serious problem for the trusted authentication feature.
fields.summary: Trusted authentication with Jiraissues macro doesn't work for users with uppercase usernames

fields.description:
When a section of text on a page is marked as bold AND underlined using the rich text editor, the resulting PDF output is not correct. In the PDF, all text following the segment of text which bold/underline is BOLD up to the next wiki notation.
Example:
 
Bold and Underline Text ABCDEFG
XYZXYZ

In the PDF, the text ABCDEFG will also be bold (but should not be), the text XYZXYZ will be formatted correctly (following a hard return in the text)

If the text is edited in Wiki Markup mode (not with the rich text editor) and the markup is altered to look like this:

Bold and Underline Text ABCDEFG

The resulting PDF, is correct. However, if you edit a page again (after saving changes in wiki markup mode), the rich text editor will convert changes back to *{+} and the PDF output will once again be incorrect.

Wiki-markup:
{noformat}
*{+}Bold and Underline Text{+}* Does NOT render correctly in PDF
+{*}Bold and Underline Text{*}+ Does render correctly in PDF
{noformat}
fields.summary: Bolded Underlined text in page creates markup errors when exported to PDF

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-10600].
  {panel}

Previously, Confluence displayed the space key in a link name when the user specified a link to a page in another space.

We found this incredibly useful, as it clearly indicated the location of the linked page, without the user having to define an alias to indicate the page's location in an alias.

Now, when our users enter the following link:
\[ENG:Home\]
the important space information "ENG:" disappears from the link, misleading readers to think that the page exists in the current space.

Please consider restoring the old behavior in the next point release of the product. Since my upgrade to 2.7, I have hundreds of pages in the wiki with links that are now broken when users edit them in the Rich Text editor. And when users fix the links by adding in the space key, their fixes are lost as soon as another user opens the page again in the Rich Text editor. It's proving to be a maintenance nightmare.

As an alternative, maybe you could add an optional syntax that would strip the space key, such as the following:
\[ENG::Home\]
which would indicate that the page creator does not want to display the space link.
fields.summary: Return to old practice of displaying space key in link if user does not specify alias

fields.description:
In Vista, one can map a WebDAV path to a drive as follows:
 - On the desktop of in the menu click "Computer"
 - Click "Map network drive"
 - Click "Connect to a website that you can use to store your documents and pictures."
 - Select "Choose a custom network location" and click "Next".
 - Enter a path like "http://192.168.0.156:8090/confluence/plugins/servlet/webdav/"
At this point I get the error:
!webdav_mapdrive.png!
After some googling, I found this [Software Update for Web Folders (KB907306)|http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyId=17C36612-632E-4C04-9382-987622ED1D64&displaylang=en]. After installing I am able to map and browse Confluence spaces.
But then, opening a page contents .txt file results in:
!webdav_openpage.png!
with Notepad, and:
!webdav_openpage_ultraedit.png!
in ultraedit. So the end to end experience is still broken.
fields.summary: Confluence WebDAV broken with Windows Vista

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-10586].
  {panel}

Overloaded methods are valid in the remote API specs for XMLRPC/SOAP. 
(*Update Oct 2008*:  apparently overloaded methods are *not* valid in the WSI Basic Profile 1.0 spec, see section 5.4.3 here http://www.ws-i.org/Profiles/BasicProfile-1.0-2004-04-16.html)

Several clients cannot (or will not?) handle overloaded methods - notably Adobe Flex & AIR.  ([more info|http://kb.adobe.com/selfservice/viewContent.do?externalId=tn_19276&sliceId=1] ) and as of Oct 2008, Apache CXF. 

I suggest that Atlassian simply change the method names for few overloaded methods.
This small change would allow all clients to use the Remote API without wonky workarounds (ex. modifying the WSDL by hand)

Cheers,
Timo
fields.summary: Remove overloaded method names in Remote API to increase compatibility

fields.description:
There are currently 3 resources on clustering with similar names:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Clusters
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Clustering+in+Confluence
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Cluster+Checklist

It doesn't seem obvious to users how these documents are intended to be used, but their relationship could be made clearer by one or all of the following:

1. Placing a link to the 'Confluence Clusters' page in the introduction of the other pages (it's already down the page in the checklist), possibly as part of an clustering pages index or 'read this first'
2. Rename 'Confluence Clusters' to 'Clustering Overview'
3. Rename 'Clustering+in+Confluence' to 'Clustering Technical Information'
4. Rename to 'Cluster+Checklist' 'Clustering Deployment Guidelines'
fields.summary: Reorganise linking between clustering documents

fields.description:
I was trying to diagnose a very strange bug in the Activity Stream plugin on my development build, where calling PageManager.getPreviousVersion(page) was actually returning the *first* version of the page, rather than the one immediately preceding the version that I passed in.

I traced it down to a bug in hsqldb: it was ignoring the "desc" in "order by contentent0_.VERSION desc" clause that Hibernate was generating.

I found this in the HSQLDB tracker, which says it is fixed in 1.8.0.2 (Confluence currently includes 1.8.0.1):
http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=1240634&group_id=23316&atid=378131

I've confirmed that the bug is fixed if I have the plugin's test harness use hsqldb-1.8.0.7 instead (1.8.0.8 isn't in the Maven repository currently).
fields.summary: Confluence uses a version of HSQLDB that sometimes returns results in wrong order

fields.description:
Several people have reported upgrades failing when moving from 2.6.x to 2.7. We need to investigate this issue and work out why it is happening. Note that server ID was introduced in 2.5.5, so all 2.6.x instances _should_ have a server ID.

{quote}
2008-01-28 14:15:14,541 ERROR main com.atlassian.upgrade.AbstractUpgradeManager doUpgrade Upgrade failed: null
java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.apache.commons.codec.digest.DigestUtils.md5(DigestUtils.java:86)
at com.atlassian.confluence.security.trust.ConfluenceTrustedApplicationsManager.getAliasForSid(ConfluenceTrustedApplicationsManager.java:166)
at com.atlassian.confluence.security.trust.ConfluenceTrustedApplicationsManager.getSystemAlias(ConfluenceTrustedApplicationsManager.java:160)
at com.atlassian.confluence.security.trust.ConfluenceTrustedApplicationsManager.getCurrentApplicationInternal(ConfluenceTrustedApplicationsManager.java:1
40)
at com.atlassian.confluence.security.trust.ConfluenceTrustedApplicationsManager.getCurrentApplication(ConfluenceTrustedApplicationsManager.java:101)
at com.atlassian.confluence.security.trust.ConfluenceTrustedApplicationsManager.initConfluenceKey(ConfluenceTrustedApplicationsManager.java:172)
{quote}

The query to check your database for a server ID is:

{code:sql}
select * from bandana where bandanakey like 'confluence.server.id';
{code}

Note: You should not make public your server ID or put it on this issue. It is used to verify your identity with Atlassian.
fields.summary: Upgrade fails due to NullPointerException in ConfluenceTrustedApplicationsManager
